| casualties_label= | howmany3 = Thousands | notes = }}'''Occupy Berlin''' is an ongoing peaceful protest and demonstration against the current regulation of financial markets and alleged social injustice. It is taking place in [[Berlin]], [[Germany]], and started as a part of [[15 October 2011 global protests]].(October 15, 2011.) [http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/occupy-bewegung-berlin-buerger-lass-das-glotzen-sein-1.1164700 Occupy-Bewegung Berlin - BÃ¼rger, lass das Glotzen sein! - Politik - sueddeutsche.de] The protest began in solidarity with the [[Occupy Wall Street]] protests in [[New York, United States]]. It has so far established 3 encampments: outside of the church [[Parochialkirche]], in [[Boxhagener Platz|Boxhagener Platz]] and the biggest one on the [[Stadtstrand|Bundespressestrand]].{{de icon}} (November 14, 2011.) [http://www.morgenpost.de/berlin-aktuell/article1821325/Occupy-Aktivisten-besetzen-Bundespressestrand.html "Occupy" activists occupy Federal Press beach."] [http://www.morgenpost.de Berliner Morgenpost]. Accessed November 2011. Occupy Berlin cooperates with similar movements throughout Germany, most notably from Frankfurt and Hamburg. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://occupyberlin.info/ Occupy Berlin, one of activist group homepage] * [https://n-1.cc/pg/groups/173039/occupy-berlin-international-ag/ AG Internationale Vernetzung, homepage] * [http://occupyberlin.net/ Occupy Berlin Network & Livestream ] {{Occupy movement}} [[Category:2011 in Germany]] [[Category:Global politics]] [[Category:History of Berlin]] [[Category:Occupy movement]] [[Category:Political activism]] [[Category:Protests in Germany]] {{Germany-stub}} [[de:Occupy Germany]]
